private_information: I can only manipulate vowel-labelled blocks. The vowel blocks present are A, E, I.
I can only move blocks that are currently at the top of a stack.
I can only move one block at a time.
vowel_agent.goal: Contribute to rearranging the blocks so that A is on B, B is on C, C is on D, D is on E, E is on F, F is on G, G is on H, H is on I, I is on J, J is on K, K is on L, and L is on the table.

private_information: I can only manipulate consonant-labelled blocks. The consonant blocks present are B, C, D, F, G, H, J, K, L.
I can only move blocks that are currently at the top of a stack.
I can only move one block at a time.
consonant_agent.goal: Contribute to rearranging the blocks so that A is on B, B is on C, C is on D, D is on E, E is on F, F is on G, G is on H, H is on I, I is on J, J is on K, K is on L, and L is on the table.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents analyses and produce a complete PDDL domain and problem for the FastDownwards solver that models the block manipulation constraints and achieves the final stacked order with agent actions kept distinct.

public_information: There are twelve uniquely labelled blocks: H, D, I, J, C, F, K, E, G, L, B, A.
Initial stacks on the table are: Stack1 bottom H then F then K on top, Stack2 bottom D then I then J then E then G then L then B on top, Stack3 bottom C then A on top.
Only the top block of any stack may be moved at any time.
Each agent may move only one block at a time.
One agent is restricted to moving vowel blocks and the other agent is restricted to moving consonant blocks.
The target final configuration is a single stack with bottom L on the table and then K, J, I, H, G, F, E, D, C, B, A with A on top.

analyze.system_prompt: You are the vowel specialist. Analyze the public information and your private information. Identify which stacks and which top blocks are vowels that you can move. Provide a concise factual representation of the current stacks, the top blocks you can legally move, and any move constraints that affect vowels. Do not emit PDDL. Return the representation as the output knowledge_vowel.
analyze.prompt: Your name is vowel_agent. Use the public information and your private information to produce a factual representation of the current block stacks and the legal moves you can perform on vowel blocks. Focus on top blocks and one at a time moves. Produce an answer suitable for an orchestrator to consume as knowledge_vowel.

analyze.system_prompt: You are the consonant specialist. Analyze the public information and your private information. Identify which stacks and which top blocks are consonants that you can move. Provide a concise factual representation of the current stacks, the top blocks you can legally move, and any move constraints that affect consonants. Do not emit PDDL. Return the representation as the output knowledge_consonant.
analyze.prompt: Your name is consonant_agent. Use the public information and your private information to produce a factual representation of the current block stacks and the legal moves you can perform on consonant blocks. Focus on top blocks and one at a time moves. Produce an answer suitable for an orchestrator to consume as knowledge_consonant.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL planning and in preparing problems for the FastDownwards planner. Integrate the factual representations from the agents and the public environment description. Produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that models the block world, enforces that only top blocks can be moved, enforces that vowel_agent actions are applicable only to vowel blocks and consonant_agent actions only to consonant blocks, and keeps agent actions distinct. The produced PDDL must be compatible with FastDownwards. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. Here is the public information: {environment->public_information} Here is the vowel agent analysis: {knowledge_vowel} Here is the consonant agent analysis: {knowledge_consonant} Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that together allow FastDownwards to find a plan that results in the target final stack with L on the table and A on top as specified in the public information. Keep actions for vowel_agent and consonant_agent distinct by naming them accordingly. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
